bibl.title: Letter from Carlos E. Finlay to [Ralph Cooper Hutchison], September 13, 1940

div1.p: Finlay writes about the location of Camp Lazear and his recently published biography of his father, Carlos J. Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Carlos E. Finlay to [Ralph Cooper Hutchison], September 13, 1940
div1.opener:
DR. C. E. FINLAY
LINEA NUMERO 710
TELEFONO F-4730
VEDADO, HABANA
CUBA
September 13 1940
President of the Washington & Jefferson College
Washington
Dear Sir
div1.p:
I received your letter of September 9. I saw Dr Hench
when he was here in April and wrote to him a few days ago

I have been pleased to give him what data I could
regarding Dr. Jesse Lazear. The location of the camp is diffi-
cult at this date is difficult owing to the changed of topo-
graphy of Marianao and to Dr. Lazear have died before the
camp where the final Yellow Fever Experiments were started in
their final quarters. My impression is that Hench is right
in thinking that the site today considered as Camp Lazear is
wrong, buy this is only an imprssion, Dr Angles who has lived
in Marianao since Spanish times and still lives there and
aided in the experiments should be the best judge. At that time
Camp Lazear was a segregated portion of a large wooden temporary
built camp in which the U.S.A. were housed since torn down and
entirely rebuilt.

I have referred Dr Hench to a Book I have just published
titled Carlos Finlay and Yellow Fever in the Oxford University
Press in New York, where he will find many data. The printing of
the book is complete and they are exhibiting it at the Annual
Meeting of the Amercan Public Health Association in Detroit at
the beginning of October. /I have written to the Editors about
furnishing Dr Hench an advance copy.

The U.S.A. Board was at its start wholly incredulous
on my father's theory, Dr Lazear who had done prior mosquito
work with Grassi in Rome having from the start demmanded that
my father's work be investigated, ultimately leading to its
complete confirmation. In a letter of Agramonte to my father
reference is made to two cases od Lazear's before the commission
started its work. Al these and more data are contained in my book
I am enclosiing a photo I have of a painting of Lazear
